author: remm
msg: - Placeholder for SlideResources, the implementation of Catalina Resources interface.
- Finally updated STATUS.html with new people volunteering for new tasks. Thanks (and sorry for  being so long to give you credit) !

- Thanks to Torgeir (torgeir@vertech.no) for pointing me out it was a nightmare to implement a  store. Now, it should be WAY easier :-) Also, it's a better, IMO, since the caching is made in  an intermediate level, between the helper level and the low level store. You can configure a  different caching layer, to choose different caching policies according to your needs.
- Adds a bunch of interfaces to the store system, one for each type. A store is something which  :
* implements at least one of these interfaces : NodeStore, LockStore, SecurityStore,
RevisionDescriptorsStore, RevisionDescriptorStore
* implements the Service interface, or extends the ServiceImpl abstract helper class, which
will probably make your life easier
- WARNING : Changed the config files format !! The documentation is correctly updated, but some
of the examples were not updated. Coming soon !
- ContentStore will be eventually treated like the other specific stores, to be consistent.  DescriptorsStore will be renamed Store. However, since :
* it involves quite a lot of changes all over the place and in the Slide core
* it's just a cleanup, since it works very well
* I have a million more urgent things to fix on Catalina, and a billion on Slide ;-)
* the implementation of a ContentStore won't change before or after this change
I have decided to postpone this change, but it will eventually happen.
- Removed the config files to enable Slide to be called through Catalina's servlet invoker,  since it's really useless.

author: remm
msg: - Fix minor error in stylesheet

author: remm
msg: - Fixes a typo in the build.bat file

author: craigmcc
msg: Define the "jaxp.home" property based on the $JAXP_HOME environment
variable.  Otherwise, attempts to copy "jaxp.jar" and "parser.jar" will
fail when the build occurs on a machine that has the JAXP release
somewhere other than "../jaxp".
